abstract.p: Gov George E Pataki says New York State is allocating $55 million in federal funds to 111 municipalities for housing, redevelopment and infrastructure projects (S)

block.p: Gov. George E. Pataki has announced that the state is allocating $55 million in federal funds to 111 municipalities for housing, redevelopment and infrastructure projects.

The money is coming from the federal government's community development program, but in the case of small municipalities with 50,000 or fewer residents, New York State is responsible for distributing the money for the first time. Previously, the federal Department of Housing and Urban Development had allocated those funds.
Gov. George E. Pataki has announced that the state is allocating $55 million in federal funds to 111 municipalities for housing, redevelopment and infrastructure projects.

The money is coming from the federal government's community development program, but in the case of small municipalities with 50,000 or fewer residents, New York State is responsible for distributing the money for the first time. Previously, the federal Department of Housing and Urban Development had allocated those funds.

Housing will be rehabilitated in Corning, N.Y., at a cost of $400,000, and Ithaca will receive $900,000 worth of neighborhood redevelopment projects. Main Street in the village of Northville in Fulton County will be revitalized with $400,000, and the sewer system in the town of Southport, in Chemung County, will be upgraded at a cost of $332,000.
